column4: All, one question regarding soundcards. I am running an ubuntu on vmware (that shouldn't matter I guess). I have a conexant soundcard and it is not recognized by the system. I wanted to check if it is just ubuntu that has this problem, or if other distro's also have a similar problem.
i am running 2.6.20.16, ubuntu feisty; and the lspci doesn't show the soundcard ( i guess it is not even recognized)
your ubuntu is in the vmware?
yes, I have installed it over vmware. ubuntu is my guest-os
then it matters a lot, hardware detection in your guest os doesnt matter at all. ITs all about your host
agreed; but i did search for the conexant soundcards and looks like it is not a supported hardware
let me have a look
whats the exact name?
also, vmware allows the guest OS to have access to the hardware, albeit via its own drivers, but nevertheless it is possible; else the scsi disk on my machine wouldn't have been detected
exact name for what ?
the soundcard ?
vmware is fully dependant on the host OS drivers, hardware access doesnt mean it can its own drivers. The full sound card name
from the windows device manager i see it as conexant high definition smart audio
if thats true then it is supported by the default driver
is there anyway i can check if there are some modules missing or something
why dont you just put in the livecd and see for yourself?
see whether the sound is detected ? Is that what you mean ?
yup
ok I can check that
thanks for your help
which of course will mean i will need to reboot the machine (the host OS too). Will check that and join the channel later if it doesn't work.
aye, good luck
thank you and bye
